isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ENGINE BRAKE INTERFACE

svcproc.title: ENGINE BRAKE INTERFACE
svcproc.para: On vehicles equipped with an engine or exhaust brake, when the switch is on, 12 volts from switch (3040) is applied on circuit 107 to gray TCM connector (3031) terminal 7.

If the TCM senses the transmission lock-up clutch is engaged, the accelerator is not applied, and the engine speed is at a preset level then a ground from the gray TCM connector (3031) terminal 20 will be applied to circuit 120. The EXHAUST BRAKE RELAY (3033) will energize and the ground originating from gray TCM connector (3031) terminal 28 on circuit 128B will pass through the closed relay contacts to circuit 24 and terminal 15 of ECM connector (379). This will allow the engine ECM to engage the engine or exhaust brake.
